episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical topics, including the life of a hermit named Roger Crab, the unique smell of the Magna Carta, Ford's use of ostrich feathers in car washes, and the classification of Tony the Tiger as an adult cartoon due to sugar content regulations.

facts.fact: Before hermit crabs were called hermit crabs, there was a hermit called Crab.
Magna Carta smells of newly pressed sheets with traces of old socks.
Ford has a car wash made of giant ostrich feather dusters.
According to Kellogg's, Tony the Tiger is an adult cartoon.
